entry.title: Grief and Joy braided together
entry.summary:
Author: Johanna_tries

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,138Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 6

Summary: That truth should have been comforting when Eddie proposed, but it was a weak reminder of everything he lost out on.So, Buck recalibrated, the way he always did.Maddie would take on the traditions - she’d dance, give a speech that would make everyone laugh and then cry in the way only she could. And she would stand with him as his best man.Hen would handle the decorations, turning Buck’s chaotic ideas into something beautiful and intentional.Chimney would be the mastermind behind the curtains, keeping the whole machine running with the frantic but brilliant energy only he had.And Bobby…. Bobby would make sure the food was perfect, the timing precise, the day steady and safe. He would know exactly what Buck or Eddie needed before either of them managed to utter a single word.But Bobby wasn’t here anymore.And Buck hadn’t understood, not really, how sharp that absence would feel until he was standing alone in a quiet suite on his wedding day. --- AKA: Buck is getting married and realizes how hard it is that Bobby isn't there to tie his tie, and proceeds to have a small breakdown about it.Luckily, Maddie is always there.

entry.title: words left unsaid, as prayer
entry.summary:
Author: forevervalentine

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,873Chapters: 2/2Kudos: 9

Summary: Set end of season 7 when Christopher has just found out about Eddie cheating on Marisol, only his departure is postponed thanks to the Diaz-Buckley annual boy’s camping trip. Unresolved feelings on many ends lead to rather messy conclusions.—-or—-“I mean I knew you were…” his friend looked him up in down in a way that made his stomach turn, “pent up. But not… this badly. I mean you haven’t even—“ “No,” Eddie interrupted, reaching for the handle of the family bathroom automatically. Buck didn’t seem phased, just entering as his friend held the door. “I haven’t…” Buck made an up and down motion with his hands clasped (still holding the offending boxers, Jesus). Eddie flushed deeper, grunting, “yeah. That. It hasn’t felt very… deserved after what I did.” His friend nodded, crossing over to the sink. “I mean, I guess. But you seriously haven’t— I mean it’s… I feel like that’s a medically necessary thing to—“ “Most Catholics are celibate for a majority of their lives.” “Well, most Catholics probably have frequent wet dreams, then.”

entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 269,922Chapters: 44/?Kudos: 22

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn’t end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they’re reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: The Spider-Man Meme!
entry.summary:
Author: Lady_Stardust1979

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,169Chapters: 5/7Kudos: 23

Summary: “Holy shit!” Chim giggled, jabbing his pointer finger at his other self repeatedly with excitement. His other self mirrored the same pose, also flinging his hand up to point excitedly at him. Noticing the mirrored position, they matched manic, feral grins and yelled in the same intonation, almost harmonising their next shout together. “Omg! We Spider-Man memed!” _______ OR: Chimeny is visited by his variant, who introduces him to the world of buddie. Chim, wanting to step up and be the best Captain for the 118 convinces Chris to help him set Buddie up to rectify this travesty.What ensues is 5 dates that Chris and Chim plan, and 1 date that they didn't have to plan. (The first chapter was an excuse for me to write Chim interacting with another version of himself and only happens in chapter 1)

entry.title: Better Think Before He Cheats (Buck's Revenge)
entry.summary:
Author: Wemily

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,755Chapters: 2/2Kudos: 70

Summary: A little bit later, both men were halfway through their third beers and feeling pleasantly buzzed as the song 'Before He Cheats' by Carrie Underwood began playing. Buck really hated that he related so hard to this song now, and the rage burning in his blood made him think he'd like to do exactly that to Tommy's truck. The curly-haired man knew that he shouldn't fantasize about destroying his ex's truck, but oh, did the thought make him want to smile.He must have looked manic because Eddie raised an eyebrow at him and asked, "Why are you smiling like that, man?"Buck hummed, "Hmm… Just thinking.""About what exactly?""About how much I'd like to reenact this song on Tommy's truck. It could be the beer and the underlying rage talking, but god, destroying his truck sounds amazing right now." The blue-eyed man groaned.

entry.title: Tell Me Why Can't This Be Love?
entry.summary:
Author: Frawg_Spawn

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,365Chapters: 1/3Kudos: 88

Summary: "It's fine, Jee," Eddie says. "Buck doesn't have to kiss me." "Yes he does." Jee crosses her arms and looks sternly at Buck. "Daddy and Mommy kiss every time when they go away from each other." "Yeah, okay." Buck sucks in a breath and steps towards Eddie. He ducks his head down and presses the most fleeting kiss to Eddie's cheek. "Not like that," Jee scolds. "What? Why not?" Buck squawks. "Because," she sighs and gives him a long, disapproving look. "Mommy and Daddy always kiss on the lips." ~ or, buddie babysit Jee while being pretend boyfriends

entry.summary:
Author: lifelessframe

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,828Chapters: 2/6Kudos: 10

Summary: One windy night, cuddling on the couch, Buck told him he wanted to have more children; one long and devastating conversation later, Eddie said he couldn’t get on board with that. The adult thing to do was to break up, after 14 wonderful months of being together. Or the 5 stages of grief as told by the rise and fall of Buck and Eddie’s relationship. Or the fall and rise. Grief is not linear, nor the same for everyone.

entry.title: Your Heart’s a Bird Without the Wings to Fly
entry.summary:
Author: catniss_37

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,002Chapters: 5/19Kudos: 73

Summary: "Buck!" Eddies voice rang through the space, abruptly cut off by the deafening sound of crumpling concrete hitting the ground. Eddie stared at the rubble now blocking the way between himself and Buck. "Buck," Eddie whimpered as he dropped to his knees in front of the pile of rubble Buck was buried under. OR If episode 9x3 actually included the subway collapse from the promo, because I'm so mad about that.Continuing the story using that as a plot point. It will be canon divergent from that point onward in season 9, episode 3.

entry.title: Surprise Baby
entry.summary:
Author: Delulu_emily

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 106,184Chapters: 31/48Kudos: 795

Summary: Buck and Eddie are a week away from getting married. But Buck hasn't been feeling good lately. So, he goes to a clinic. Turns out he’s pregnant with Eddie Diaz’s baby. Buck’s nervous to tell Eddie, but Eddie’s over the moon. Oh, and Eddie loves seeing his now husband pregnant with their baby. (Smut ahead) The two men bond stronger with their family/the team. But especially with Bobby, Athena, and Chris. And each other. This is the story of Buddie’s first surprise baby.

entry.title: He runs in. He runs out. He comes home.
entry.summary:
Author: dramione1997

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 27,551Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 35

Summary: A single disaster doesn’t end a life - it just changes the shape of it. After surviving the tsunami that nearly killed him and tore his world apart, firefighter Evan Buckley becomes the department’s favourite cautionary tale: brave, reckless, irreplaceable, and one bad call away from never coming home again. When the review board forces him out of his old house and into an unfamiliar station, Buck is prepared to do his job in silence until he burns out for good. Except Station 123 refuses to let him disappear. A captain who wants to help but keeps getting it wrong, a new partner who idolises him and won’t stop trying, a child who doesn’t breathe on scene and changes everything, and a family he swears he doesn’t deserve - one shift at a time, Buck is pushed toward something he thought he lost forever: a future. This is a story about trauma and recovery, found family, choosing to live when survival isn’t enough, and learning that running into danger means nothing unless you also run back out again. He doesn’t just save lives.He learns how to stay for his own.

entry.title: say my name and everything just stops
entry.summary:
Author: wylanvanecks

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,007Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 32

Summary: Over the past month, Buck had… changed. It was subtle. His senses were suddenly dialed to eleven—he could hear and smell much more than he should've been able to, and he could even see better at night, somehow. It hadn't all come on at once, each improved sense had just kind of crept up on him in the days and weeks following the bite. Which still looked weird. It had fully healed and became just a scar within a day and a half, but it wasn't like any of the other scars Buck carried. It looked almost silvery, and he felt like he could still pick out each individual toothmark, detailed in a way that made it look more tattoo-like than scar-like. Buck's sudden super-healing hadn't stopped with the not-dog but supposedly not-wolf bite. Every minor scrape and bruise would heal and disappear about three times faster than they used to. It was eerie, honestly. OR Buck got bit by a werewolf and turns for the first time. Eddie brings him back.

entry.title: Drifting Away
entry.summary:
Author: Spacers24

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,628Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 78

Summary: Eddie saw the patient lying on the street, blood all around them. There's a few produce lying around and some broken beer can, looks like the patient was just done with grocery shopping when they got hit. It's only when he gets closer that he recognizes who the patient is.    His blood turns cold as he sees a broken and bloodied Buck lying on the ground.    “BUCK!!”  ===========Caught in an accident on his day off, Buck slips into a deep coma. The 118 is left reeling as Buck's life hangs in the balance, can they pull themselves together and will Buck ever wake up?
